    • Constructor Detail

      • Searcher

        public Searcher(@NonNull
                com.algolia.search.saas.Index index)
        Create and initialize the helper.
        Parameters:
        index - an Index initialized and eventually configured.

      • Searcher

        public Searcher(@NonNull
                String appId,
                @NonNull
                String apiKey,
                @NonNull
                String indexName)
        Create and initialize the helper.
        Parameters:
        appId - Your Algolia Application ID.
        apiKey - A search-only API Key. (never use API keys that could modify your records! see https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/security/api-keys)
        indexName - An index to target.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        @Deprecated
public static Searcher get(int id)
        Deprecated. 

      • search

        @NonNull
public Searcher search(String queryString)
        Start a search with the given text.
        Parameters:
        queryString - a String to search on the index.

      • search

        @NonNull
public Searcher search()
        Start a search with the current helper's state.

      • loadMore

        @NonNull
public Searcher loadMore()
        Load more results with the same query. Note that this method won't do anything if shouldLoadMore() returns false.

      • shouldLoadMore

        public boolean shouldLoadMore()
        Tell if we should load more hits when reaching the end of an AlgoliaResultsListener.
        Returns:
        true unless we reached the end of hits or we already requested a new page.

      • reset

        @NonNull
public Searcher reset()
        Reset the helper's state.

      • hasPendingRequests

        public boolean hasPendingRequests()
        Checks if some requests are still waiting for a response.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one pending request.

      • cancelPendingRequests

        public Searcher cancelPendingRequests()
        Cancels all requests still waiting for a response.

      • addFacet

        public void addFacet(@NonNull
                     String attributeName,
                     boolean isDisjunctiveFacet,
                     @Nullable
                     ArrayList<String> values)
        Add a facet refinement for the next queries.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the facet name.
        isDisjunctiveFacet - if true, the facet will be added as a disjunctive facet.
        values - an eventual list of values to refine on.

      • updateFacetRefinement

        @NonNull
public Searcher updateFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                               String attributeName,
                                               @NonNull
                                               String value,
                                               boolean active)
        Add or remove this facet according to its enabled status.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the attribute to facet on.
        value - the value for this attribute.
        active - true if this facet value is currently refined on.

      • addFacetRefinement

        @NonNull
public Searcher addFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                            String attributeName,
                                            @NonNull
                                            String value)
        Add a facet refinement for the next queries. This method resets the current page to 0.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the attribute to refine on.
        value - the facet's value to refine with.

      • removeFacetRefinement

        @NonNull
public Searcher removeFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                               String attributeName,
                                               @NonNull
                                               String value)
        Remove a facet refinement for the next queries. This method resets the current page to 0.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the attribute to refine on.
        value - the facet's value to refine with.

      • hasFacetRefinement

        public boolean hasFacetRefinement(@NonNull
                                  String attributeName,
                                  @NonNull
                                  String value)
        Check if a facet refinement is enabled.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the attribute to refine on.
        value - the facet's value to check.
        Returns:
        true if attributeName is being refined with value.

      • clearFacetRefinements

        public Searcher clearFacetRefinements()
        Clear all facet refinements for the next queries. This method resets the current page to 0.

      • clearFacetRefinements

        public Searcher clearFacetRefinements(@NonNull
                                      String attribute)
        Clear an attribute's facet refinements for the next queries. This method resets the current page to 0.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute's name.

      • getNumericRefinement

        @Nullable
public NumericRefinement getNumericRefinement(@NonNull
                                                        String attribute,
                                                        int operator)
        Get the current numeric refinement for an attribute and an operator.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to refine on.
        operator - one of the operators defined in NumericRefinement.
        Returns:
        a NumericRefinement describing the current refinement for these parameters, or null if there is none.

      • addNumericRefinement

        public Searcher addNumericRefinement(@NonNull
                                     NumericRefinement refinement)
        Add a numeric refinement.
        Parameters:
        refinement - a NumericRefinement refining an attribute with a numerical value.

      • removeNumericRefinement

        public Searcher removeNumericRefinement(@NonNull
                                        String attribute)
        Remove any numeric refinements relative to a specific attribute.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute that may have a refinement.

      • removeNumericRefinement

        public Searcher removeNumericRefinement(@NonNull
                                        String attribute,
                                        int operator)
        Remove the numeric refinement for a specific attribute and operator.
        Parameters:
        attribute - an attribute that maybe has some refinements.
        operator - an operator.

      • removeNumericRefinement

        public Searcher removeNumericRefinement(@NonNull
                                        NumericRefinement refinement)
        Remove the numeric refinement for a specific attribute and operator.
        Parameters:
        refinement - a description of the refinement to remove.

        public Searcher addBooleanFilter(String attribute,
                                 Boolean value)
        Add a boolean refinement.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to refine on.
        value - the value to refine with.

      • getBooleanFilter

        @Nullable
public Boolean getBooleanFilter(String attribute)
        Get the current boolean refinement for an attribute.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute that may have a refinement.
        Returns:
        the refinement value, or null if there is none.

      • removeBooleanFilter

        public Searcher removeBooleanFilter(String attribute)
        Remove any boolean refinement for an attribute.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute that may have a refinement.

        @NonNull
public Searcher setQuery(@NonNull
                                  com.algolia.search.saas.Query query)
        Use the given query's parameters for following search queries.
        Parameters:
        query - a Query object with some parameters set.

      • getIndex

        public com.algolia.search.saas.Index getIndex()

      • setIndex

        @NonNull
public Searcher setIndex(@NonNull
                                  String indexName)
        Change the targeted index for future queries. Be aware that as index ordering may differ, this method will reset the current page to 0, You may want to use reset() to reinitialize the helper to an empty state.
        Parameters:
        indexName - name of the new index.

public int getId()
        Deprecated.
